title: Correcting Projector Lens Aberrations for High-Resolution Electron Ptychography
content: Electron ptychography is a powerful technique renowned for its ability to high-resolution imaging with low dose requirement [1] and facilitating a comprehensive understanding of the three-dimensional structure of materials [2]. In practice, aberration in projective lens (or equivalent) can result in significant distortion of the measured diffraction patterns, especially when complex post-specimen optics are involved, such as doing 4D-STEM using the EELS camera. The projector lens aberration (PLA) causes issues when the entire Convergent Beam Electron Diffraction (CBED) pattern is utilized for ptychographic reconstruction including the extended ptychographical iterative engine (ePIE) method.
